short_definition: Presentence step in which the judge asks the defendant whether he has any legal cause to show why judgment should not be pronounced against him, or whether he would like to make statement on his behalf and present any information in mitigation of sentence. It permits defendants to speak in their own behalf in criminal cases prior to sentencing and to present any information in mitigation of punishment procedure.
